title: Unique Binary Search Trees
content_html:
Given an integer n, return the number of structurally unique BST's (binary search trees) which has exactly n nodes of unique values from 1 to n.

 

Example 1:

Input: n = 3
Output: 5

Example 2:

Input: n = 1
Output: 1

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= n <= 19
content_markdown:

question: Given an integer `n`, return _the number of structurally unique**BST '**s (binary search trees) which has exactly _`n` _nodes of unique values from_ `1` _to_ `n`.
